etymology.description: 医(醫) (yī, "medical"), 药(藥) (yào, "medicine"), 费(費) (fèi, "expense")
etymology.interpretation: 医药费(醫藥費) (yīyàofèi, "medical expenses") combines the elements of medical care and medicine with costs, referring to the money spent on medical treatments and medications.

examples.chinese: 她及时交医药费(她及時交醫藥費)。
examples.english: She paid the medical expenses promptly.

examples.chinese: 当病情加重时(當病情加重時)，他必须交医药费(他必須交醫藥費)。
examples.pinyin: Dāng bìngqíng jiāzhòng shí, tā bìxū jiāo yīyàofèi.
examples.english: When his condition worsened, he had to pay the medical expenses.

examples.chinese: 为了获得治疗(為了獲得治療)，他们节省钱并交医药费(他們節省錢並交醫藥費)。
examples.pinyin: Wèile huòdé zhìliáo, tāmen jiéshěng qián bìng jiāo yīyàofèi.
examples.english: In order to get treatment, they saved money and paid the medical expenses.
